items.title: Netanyahu orders strikes on Gaza, accusing Hamas of returning wrong hostage remains
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Tuesday he has ordered the military to carry out powerful strikes on the Gaza Strip. This comes after Israel accused Hamas of violating their fragile peace deal by returning the wrong remains of a hostage. BBC security correspondent Frank Gardner joins CBS News with more.
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Tuesday he has ordered the military to carry out powerful strikes on the Gaza Strip. This comes after Israel accused Hamas of violating their fragile peace deal by returning the wrong remains of a hostage. BBC security correspondent Frank Gardner joins CBS News with more.

items.title: Netanyahu orders Israeli army to carry out "powerful strikes" in Gaza
items.standfirst: The order from Netanyahu follows heightened tensions after Hamas returned a set of remains that Israel said belonged to a hostage recovered earlier in the war.
items.content: The order from Netanyahu follows heightened tensions after Hamas returned a set of remains that Israel said belonged to a hostage recovered earlier in the war.

items.title: Netanyahu orders immediate 'powerful' strikes on Gaza
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Tuesday ordered "powerful" airstrikes on Gaza, imperiling the fragile U.S.-brokered ceasefire."Following security consultations, Prime Minister Netanyahu instructed the military echelon to carry out powerful strikes in the Gaza Strip immediately," his office said in a statement.
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Tuesday ordered "powerful" airstrikes on Gaza, imperiling the fragile U.S.-brokered ceasefire."Following security consultations, Prime Minister Netanyahu instructed the military echelon to carry out powerful strikes in the Gaza Strip immediately," his office said in a statement.

items.content: Blasts have been heard in Gaza after Israel's prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu ordered his military to carry out "powerful" air strikes.

items.title: Israel launches strikes on Gaza after Netanyahu accuses Hamas of breaching ceasefire
items.standfirst: Prime minister accuses Hamas of ‘clear violation’ of truce as far-right ministers clamour to resume warIsraeli warplanes struck Gaza on Tuesday night shortly after Israel’s prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, ordered the military to carry out “powerful strikes” in Gaza, in the latest test of the increasingly shaky US-brokered ceasefire.Witnesses reported seeing Israeli planes launch strikes on Gaza City, as well as explosions across the strip shortly after Netanyahu’s announcement. Continue reading...
items.content: Prime minister accuses Hamas of ‘clear violation’ of truce as far-right ministers clamour to resume warIsraeli warplanes struck Gaza on Tuesday night shortly after Israel’s prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, ordered the military to carry out “powerful strikes” in Gaza, in the latest test of the increasingly shaky US-brokered ceasefire.Witnesses reported seeing Israeli planes launch strikes on Gaza City, as well as explosions across the strip shortly after Netanyahu’s announcement. Continue reading...

items.title: Hamas returns remains of Israeli hostage after Red Cross’s help in search
items.standfirst: Exclusive: Red Cross acts as ‘neutral intermediary’ to recover hostages’ remains in areas under Israeli controlThe International Committee of the Red Cross has accompanied members of Hamas inside areas of Gaza still under the control of the Israeli military to facilitate the search for the bodies of Israeli hostages, as the Palestinian militant group delivered the remains of another captive.Under the US-brokered ceasefire, which took effect on 10 October, Hamas is required to return the remains of all Israeli hostages as soon as possible. In exchange, Israel has agreed to hand over 15 Palestinian bodies for each Israeli. Continue reading...
items.content: Exclusive: Red Cross acts as ‘neutral intermediary’ to recover hostages’ remains in areas under Israeli controlThe International Committee of the Red Cross has accompanied members of Hamas inside areas of Gaza still under the control of the Israeli military to facilitate the search for the bodies of Israeli hostages, as the Palestinian militant group delivered the remains of another captive.Under the US-brokered ceasefire, which took effect on 10 October, Hamas is required to return the remains of all Israeli hostages as soon as possible. In exchange, Israel has agreed to hand over 15 Palestinian bodies for each Israeli. Continue reading...

Israel accused Hamas of violating the ceasefire by returning the wrong hostage remains.
Hamas delayed returning a hostage's body, citing Israeli ceasefire violations.
The strikes threaten the ceasefire brokered by President Trump.
The military action follows heightened tensions and accusations of truce violations.

items.title: Hurricane Melissa: a visual guide to Jamaica’s strongest storm since 1851
items.standfirst: Slow-moving giant makes landfall and will linger over the island before slamming into CubaHurricane Melissa – latest updatesHurricane Melissa has made landfall in Jamaica as a catastrophic category 5 storm, the strongest to lash the island since record-keeping began in 1851.The slow-moving giant hit the island on Tuesday afternoon and is expected to linger, moving diagonally through it until heading on to slam into Cuba, with impacts also expected in Haiti and the Bahamas. Continue reading...

items.title: Hurricane Melissa makes landfall in Jamaica
items.standfirst: Jamaica’s government says it has done all it can to prepare for strongest hurricane in country since records beganHurricane Melissa – latest updatesHurricane Melissa has made landfall in Jamaica, where sheltering residents braced themselves against ferocious winds, heavy flood waters and landslides from the category 5 storm, one of the strongest Atlantic hurricanes in history.The slow-moving colossus is the most intense hurricane to hit Jamaica since records began in 1851 and will linger over the island for hours before turning north-east. As the hurricane came ashore, its winds tore roofs off buildings and left boulders tumbling into roads. Continue reading...
items.content: Jamaica’s government says it has done all it can to prepare for strongest hurricane in country since records beganHurricane Melissa – latest updatesHurricane Melissa has made landfall in Jamaica, where sheltering residents braced themselves against ferocious winds, heavy flood waters and landslides from the category 5 storm, one of the strongest Atlantic hurricanes in history.The slow-moving colossus is the most intense hurricane to hit Jamaica since records began in 1851 and will linger over the island for hours before turning north-east. As the hurricane came ashore, its winds tore roofs off buildings and left boulders tumbling into roads. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Two dozen states sue White House over food stamps suspension amid shutdown
clusters.neutral_headline: States Sue Over Food Stamp Suspension During Shutdown

items.title: Two dozen states sue White House over food stamps suspension amid shutdown
items.standfirst: Federal food assistance benefits for low-income families set to expire on 1 November due to government shutdownA coalition of more than two dozen states on Tuesday sued the Trump administration over its decision to suspend food stamps during the government shutdown.The lawsuit, co-led by New York, California and Massachusetts, asks a federal judge to force the US Department of Agriculture to tap into emergency reserve funds to distribute food benefits to the nearly 42 million families and children who rely on the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (Snap). The USDA has said no benefits will be issued on 1 November. Continue reading...
items.content: Federal food assistance benefits for low-income families set to expire on 1 November due to government shutdownA coalition of more than two dozen states on Tuesday sued the Trump administration over its decision to suspend food stamps during the government shutdown.The lawsuit, co-led by New York, California and Massachusetts, asks a federal judge to force the US Department of Agriculture to tap into emergency reserve funds to distribute food benefits to the nearly 42 million families and children who rely on the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (Snap). The USDA has said no benefits will be issued on 1 November. Continue reading...

items.title: Louisiana declares state of emergency over looming SNAP benefits pause

items.content: Louisiana Gov. Jeff Landry declared a state of emergency over the looming pause on the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) amid the ongoing government shutdown. CBS News reporter Kati Weis has more details.

items.title: 25 states sue Trump administration over food stamp freeze during shutdown

items.content: Officials from half the states and the District of Columbia are asking a federal judge to order the Department of Agriculture to provide food stamp benefits for November.

items.title: Duffy warns more travel delays are coming amid government shutdown

items.content: Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy addressed reporters at New York's LaGuardia Airport on Tuesday to discuss travel delays stemming from the ongoing government shutdown. CBS News' Tom Hanson has more details.

items.title: Brigitte Macron's life 'deteriorated' after alleged cyber-bullying, daughter says

items.content: Tiphaine Auzière was testifying in the trial of ten people accused of cyber-bullying her mother, the French first lady.

items.title: False claims online damaged Brigitte Macron’s quality of life, daughter tells court
items.standfirst: Tiphaine Auzière spoke at trial of 10 people accused of harassment by posting claims that French first lady was born a manBrigitte Macron’s daughter has told a Paris court that false claims online that the French first lady was born a man had damaged her mother’s quality of life, leaving her worrying every day about the clothes she wears and how she stands.Tiphaine Auzière, 41, a lawyer, was called as a witness at the trial of 10 people accused of online harassment of Brigitte Macron by creating or reposting social media posts falsely claiming she was a man. Continue reading...
items.content: Tiphaine Auzière spoke at trial of 10 people accused of harassment by posting claims that French first lady was born a manBrigitte Macron’s daughter has told a Paris court that false claims online that the French first lady was born a man had damaged her mother’s quality of life, leaving her worrying every day about the clothes she wears and how she stands.Tiphaine Auzière, 41, a lawyer, was called as a witness at the trial of 10 people accused of online harassment of Brigitte Macron by creating or reposting social media posts falsely claiming she was a man. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Tiphaine Auzière testified in a trial about cyber-bullying of her mother.

She worries about her appearance due to the online claims.
Auzière was a witness in the trial.

clusters.neutral_headline: Nvidia to Invest $1 Billion in Nokia in AI Networking Push

items.title: Nvidia to invest $1 billion in Nokia in AI networking push
items.standfirst: (Bloomberg/Jillian Deutsch) — Nvidia Corp. plans to make a $1 billion equity investment in Nokia Oyj, as the AI sector’s kingmaker bets on the Finnish company’s pivot from mobile networking kit into artificial intelligence. Nokia will issue about 166 million shares to Nvidia at $6.01 apiece,…
items.content: (Bloomberg/Jillian Deutsch) — Nvidia Corp. plans to make a $1 billion equity investment in Nokia Oyj, as the AI sector’s kingmaker bets on the Finnish company’s pivot from mobile networking kit into artificial intelligence. Nokia will issue about 166 million shares to Nvidia at $6.01 apiece,…

items.title: Nvidia to Invest $1 Billion in Nokia in AI Networking Push
items.standfirst: Nvidia Corp. plans to make a $1 billion equity investment in Nokia Oyj, as the AI sector’s kingmaker bets on the Finnish company’s pivot from mobile networking kit into artificial intelligence. Nokia shares jumped the most in more than a decade.
items.content: Nvidia Corp. plans to make a $1 billion equity investment in Nokia Oyj, as the AI sector’s kingmaker bets on the Finnish company’s pivot from mobile networking kit into artificial intelligence. Nokia shares jumped the most in more than a decade.

ai_summary: Nvidia will invest $1 billion in Nokia.
The investment is in Nokia's AI networking.
Nokia will issue shares to Nvidia.
Nokia shares jumped after the announcement.
Nvidia is betting on Nokia's AI pivot.

clusters.title: OpenAI completes shift to becoming for-profit
clusters.neutral_headline: OpenAI Gives Microsoft 27% Stake, Completes For-Profit Shift

items.title: OpenAI completes shift to becoming for-profit
items.standfirst: The deal will see long term investor Microsoft retain a 27% stake in the ChatGPT-maker.
items.content: The deal will see long term investor Microsoft retain a 27% stake in the ChatGPT-maker.

items.title: OpenAI Gives Microsoft 27% Stake, Completes For-Profit Shift
items.standfirst: OpenAI is giving its long-time backer Microsoft Corp. a 27% ownership stake as part of a restructuring plan that took nearly a year to negotiate, removing a major uncertainty for both companies and clearing the path for the ChatGPT maker to become a for-profit business.
items.content: OpenAI is giving its long-time backer Microsoft Corp. a 27% ownership stake as part of a restructuring plan that took nearly a year to negotiate, removing a major uncertainty for both companies and clearing the path for the ChatGPT maker to become a for-profit business.

ai_summary: OpenAI completed its shift to for-profit status.
Microsoft will retain a 27% stake in OpenAI.
The restructuring took nearly a year to negotiate.
It removes uncertainty for both companies.
It clears the path for OpenAI's for-profit status.

clusters.title: Apple Achieves $4 Trillion Market Cap Amid Strong Demand for New iPhone
clusters.neutral_headline: Apple Achieves $4 Trillion Market Cap Amid Strong Demand for New iPhone

items.title: Apple Achieves $4 Trillion Market Cap Amid Strong Demand for New iPhone
items.standfirst: Stronger-than-expected demand for the new iPhone 17 series reportedly helped drive Apple’s market capitalization above $4 trillion on Tuesday (Oct. 28). Apple became the third public company to reach that milestone, following Nvidia and Microsoft, which both reached it in July, Bloomberg…
items.content: Stronger-than-expected demand for the new iPhone 17 series reportedly helped drive Apple’s market capitalization above $4 trillion on Tuesday (Oct. 28). Apple became the third public company to reach that milestone, following Nvidia and Microsoft, which both reached it in July, Bloomberg…

items.title: Apple Becomes Third Stock in History to Top $4 Trillion in Value
items.standfirst: Apple Inc. shares rose as much 0.4% to hit $4 trillion in market value, making the iPhone maker only the third public company in history to reach the milestone.
items.content: Apple Inc. shares rose as much 0.4% to hit $4 trillion in market value, making the iPhone maker only the third public company in history to reach the milestone.

ai_summary: Apple's market capitalization reached $4 trillion.
This was driven by strong demand for the new iPhone.
Apple is the third company to reach this milestone.
Nvidia and Microsoft reached $4 trillion in July.
Apple's shares rose to hit the milestone.

clusters.title: Saudi AI Chief Vows Not to Use Huawei Tech in Bid for US Chips
clusters.neutral_headline: Saudi AI Chief Vows Not to Use Huawei Tech in US Chips Bid

items.title: Saudi AI Chief Vows Not to Use Huawei Tech in Bid for US Chips
Saudi AI Chief Vows Not to Use Huawei Tech in US Chips Bid
items.standfirst: Tareq Amin, the head of Saudi Arabia’s artificial intelligence startup Humain, said he is confident the US will clear the sale of advanced chips to the kingdom after his firm provided detailed guarantees to American officials.
items.content: Tareq Amin, the head of Saudi Arabia’s artificial intelligence startup Humain, said he is confident the US will clear the sale of advanced chips to the kingdom after his firm provided detailed guarantees to American officials.

ai_summary: The Saudi AI chief will not use Huawei tech.
This is part of the bid for US chips.
Tareq Amin leads the Saudi AI startup Humain.
He is confident the US will approve chip sales.
He provided guarantees to US officials.

clusters.title: ‘No survivors’: Kenyan plane crash kills 10 tourists and pilot
clusters.neutral_headline: Plane Crash in Kenya Kills Tourists and Pilot

items.title: ‘No survivors’: Kenyan plane crash kills 10 tourists and pilot
items.standfirst: Footage shows the smoldering remains of an airplane that crashed in Kwale, Kenya on Tuesday.
items.content: Footage shows the smoldering remains of an airplane that crashed in Kwale, Kenya on Tuesday.

items.title: Eleven people killed after tourist plane crashes in Kenya
items.standfirst: Eleven people have been killed after a plane carrying tourists to a Kenyan safari reserve crashed.
items.content: Eleven people have been killed after a plane carrying tourists to a Kenyan safari reserve crashed.

ai_summary: A plane crashed in Kwale, Kenya, resulting in the deaths of ten tourists and the pilot.
Footage shows the wreckage of the airplane after the crash.
The plane was carrying tourists to a Kenyan safari reserve.
Eleven people were killed in the plane crash.
The incident is under investigation by Kenyan authorities.
